info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 02 at 5:57PM CDT until May 02 at 6:30PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM CDT FOR NORTHERN GRADY...NORTHEASTERN CADDO...SOUTHWESTERN OKLAHOMA... NORTHWESTERN CLEVELAND...EASTERN CANADIAN AND NORTHWESTERN MCCLAIN COUNTIES... At 557 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Yukon, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Two inch hail and 70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Oklahoma City, southwestern Edmond, El Reno, Newcastle, Yukon, Bethany, Mustang, Warr Acres, The Village, Tuttle, Piedmont, Nichols Hills, Union City, Minco, Cogar, Forest Park, Woodlawn Park, Lake Aluma and Richland. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A tornado watch remains in effect for the warned area. Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
